parameters.jsCode:
/**
USER TUTORIAL
======================

This workflow requires you to use your ChatGPT account to generate the **JavaScript code** from your bank PDFs. Here's how to do it:

1. Open your ChatGPT account (chat.openai.com or other official interface).
2. Use the first workflow to generate a JSON containing at least 2 PDF extracts from your bank account.
3. Open a new conversation in ChatGPT and send the text with the prompt below.
4. ChatGPT will return a **complete JavaScript script**, ready to copy-paste into an n8n Code node named "Parse PDF Text".
5. This JavaScript code will automatically:
   - Read the PDF text provided in the JSON input to the node.
   - Extract each transaction with the fields:
       - Date: first date of the transaction (DD/MM/YYYY)
       - Value Date: second date of the transaction (DD/MM/YYYY)
       - Amount: positive for credits, negative for debits
       - Label: description of the transaction
       - Debit: amount if debit
       - Credit: amount if credit
   - Concatenate multi-line labels
   - Correctly handle thousand separators and decimal commas
   - Remove all sensitive information (account numbers, names, banking references)
   - Add an "Errors" field if some values are invalid
   - Return a JSON array in n8n format, each element being an object { json: {...} }
6. Copy the generated JavaScript code and paste it directly into the "Parse PDF Text" node in your workflow.
*/

/**
PROMPT TO SEND TO CHATGPT
=============================

You are a JavaScript developer specialized in n8n. I will provide the raw text of a bank PDF.

Generate a **complete JavaScript script** to copy-paste into an n8n Code node named "Parse PDF Text", which will:

1. Read the PDF text (provided as JSON input to the node).
2. Extract each transaction with the fields:
    - "Date": first date on the line (DD/MM/YYYY)
    - "Value Date": second date on the line (DD/MM/YYYY)
    - "Amount": transaction amount (positive for credits, negative for debits)
    - "Label": description of the transaction
    - "Debit": amount if debit
    - "Credit": amount if credit
3. Concatenate multi-line labels.
4. Correctly handle thousand separators and decimal commas.
5. Remove all sensitive information (account numbers, names, banking references).
6. Add an "Errors" field if some values are invalid.
7. Return a JSON array in n8n format, each element being an object { json: {...} }.
8. Pay attention to the name of the JSON field containing the text input (usually "text" if generated by n8n).
9. All transactions should initially be in Debit.

Provide the **complete JavaScript code**, ready to paste into the Code node, with clear comments explaining the logic.

Do not provide any ready-made JSON, only the JavaScript code.

Here is the PDF text:
<<<INSERT JSON GENERATED BY FIRST WORKFLOW HERE>>>
*/

parameters.content:
## "Parse PDF Text"
The "Parse PDF Text" node must be generated via ChatGPT using the provided prompt (click the node to see the prompt).

## WORKFLOW for the "Parse PDF Text" node
Retrieve at least 2 PDF files from your bank and extract the data. You will use it in the second workflow to generate extraction code for all PDF files from your bank.
### Output to insert into the "Parse PDF Text" node

## "Format Transaction"
Directly specify in the "Format Transaction" node the keywords that indicate which entries should be converted to Credit. By default, all entries are in Debit, so you need to indicate exceptions and manually verify the generated file.
